meanings.definition: The state or quality of being pneumatic.
meanings.sent1: The pneumaticity of the tire allowed it to absorb shocks on the bumpy road.
meanings.sent2: The pneumaticity of the balloon made it float effortlessly in the air.
meanings.sent3: The clown's exaggerated pneumaticity made everyone laugh at the circus.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like the pneumaticity of a balloon, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The pneumaticity of the inflatable mattress made it comfortable to sleep on.

meanings.definition: The presence of air-filled cavities in an organism or structure.
meanings.sent1: The bird's pneumaticity in its bones allowed it to fly with ease.
meanings.sent2: The engineer studied the pneumaticity of the building's design to ensure proper ventilation.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected pneumaticity in the cake made it rise higher than expected in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The pneumaticity of the football was crucial for players to get a good grip during the game.
meanings.sent5: The pneumaticity of the inflatable pool float kept it afloat in the water.
